t: Matthew 23
Seven Woes to the Scribes and Pharisees
Then*p Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples,
“The*r scribes*r and*r the*r Pharisees*r sit*r on*r Moses’*r seat,*r
so*r do*r and*r observe*r whatever*r they*r tell*r you,*r but*r not*r the*r works*r they*r do.*r For*r they*r preach,*r but*r do*r not*r practice.*r
They*r tie*r up*r heavy*r burdens,*r hard*r to*r bear,*r and*r lay*r them*r on*r people’s*r shoulders,*r but*r they*r themselves*r are*r not*r willing*r to*r move*r them*r with*r their*r finger.*r
They*r do*r all*r their*r deeds*r to*r be*r seen*r by*r others.*r For*r they*r make*r their*r phylacteries*r broad*r and*r their*r fringes*r long,*r
and*r they*r love*r the*r place*r of*r honor*r at*r feasts*r and*r the*r best*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues*r
and*r greetings*r in*r the*r marketplaces*r and*r being*r called*r rabbi*r by*r others.*r
But*r you*r are*r not*r to*r be*r called*r rabbi,*r for*r you*r have*r one*r teacher,*r and*r you*r are*r all*r brothers.*r
And*r call*r no*r man*r your*r father*r on*r earth,*r for*r you*r have*r one*r Father,*r who*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
Neither*r be*r called*r instructors,*r for*r you*r have*r one*r instructor,*r the*r Christ.*r
The*r greatest*r among*r you*r shall*r be*r your*r servant.*r
Whoever*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r and*r whoever*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.*r

“But*rp woe*r to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r shut*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r in*r people’s*r faces.*r For*r you*r neither*r enter*r yourselves*r nor*r allow*r those*r who*r would*r enter*r to*r go*r in.*r

Woe*r to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r travel*r across*r sea*r and*r land*r to*r make*r a*r single*r proselyte,*r and*r when*r he*r becomes*r a*r proselyte,*r you*r make*r him*r twice*r as*r much*r a*r child*r of*r hell*r as*r yourselves.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r blind*r guides,*r who*r say,*r ‘If*r anyone*r swears*r by*r the*r temple,*r it*r is*r nothing,*r but*r if*r anyone*r swears*r by*r the*r gold*r of*r the*r temple,*r he*r is*r bound*r by*r his*r oath.’*r
You*r blind*r fools!*r For*r which*r is*r greater,*r the*r gold*r or*r the*r temple*r that*r has*r made*r the*r gold*r sacred?*r

And*r you*r say,*r ‘If*r anyone*r swears*r by*r the*r altar,*r it*r is*r nothing,*r but*r if*r anyone*r swears*r by*r the*r gift*r that*r is*r on*r the*r altar,*r he*r is*r bound*r by*r his*r oath.’*r
You*r blind*r men!*r For*r which*r is*r greater,*r the*r gift*r or*r the*r altar*r that*r makes*r the*r gift*r sacred?*r
So*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r altar*r swears*r by*r it*r and*r by*r everything*r on*r it.*r
And*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r temple*r swears*r by*r it*r and*r by*r him*r who*r dwells*r in*r it.*r
And*r whoever*r swears*r by*r heaven*r swears*r by*r the*r throne*r of*r God*r and*r by*r him*r who*r sits*r upon*r it.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r tithe*r mint*r and*r dill*r and*r cumin,*r and*r have*r neglected*r the*r weightier*r matters*r of*r the*r law:*r justice*r and*r mercy*r and*r faithfulness.*r These*r you*r ought*r to*r have*r done,*r without*r neglecting*r the*r others.*r
You*r blind*r guides,*r straining*r out*r a*r gnat*r and*r swallowing*r a*r camel!*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r clean*r the*r outside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r the*r plate,*r but*r inside*r they*r are*r full*r of*r greed*r and*r self-indulgence.*r
You*r blind*r Pharisee!*r First*r clean*r the*r inside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r the*r plate,*r that*r the*r outside*r also*r may*r be*r clean.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r are*r like*r whitewashed*r tombs,*r which*r outwardly*r appear*r beautiful,*r but*r within*r are*r full*r of*r dead*r people’s*r bones*r and*r all*r uncleanness.*r
So*r you*r also*r outwardly*r appear*r righteous*r to*r others,*r but*r within*r you*r are*r full*r of*r hypocrisy*r and*r lawlessness.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r build*r the*r tombs*r of*r the*r prophets*r and*r decorate*r the*r monuments*r of*r the*r righteous,*r
saying,*r ‘If*r we*r had*r lived*r in*r the*r days*r of*r our*r fathers,*r we*r would*r not*r have*r taken*r part*r with*r them*r in*r shedding*r the*r blood*r of*r the*r prophets.’*r
Thus*r you*r witness*r against*r yourselves*r that*r you*r are*r sons*r of*r those*r who*r murdered*r the*r prophets.*r
Fill*r up,*r then,*r the*r measure*r of*r your*r fathers.*r
You*r serpents,*r you*r brood*r of*r vipers,*r how*r are*r you*r to*r escape*r being*r sentenced*r to*r hell?*r

Therefore*r I*r send*r you*r prophets*r and*r wise*r men*r and*r scribes,*r some*r of*r whom*r you*r will*r kill*r and*r crucify,*r and*r some*r you*r will*r flog*r in*r your*r synagogues*r and*r persecute*r from*r town*r to*r town,*r

so*r that*r on*r you*r may*r come*r all*r the*r righteous*r blood*r shed*r on*r earth,*r from*r the*r blood*r of*r righteous*r Abel*r to*r the*r blood*r of*r Zechariah*r the*r son*r of*r Barachiah,*r whom*r you*r murdered*r between*r the*r sanctuary*r and*r the*r altar.*r
Truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r all*r these*r things*r will*r come*r upon*r this*r generation.*r
Lament over Jerusalem

“O*rp Jerusalem,*r Jerusalem,*r the*r city*r that*r kills*r the*r prophets*r and*r stones*r those*r who*r are*r sent*r to*r it!*r How*r often*r would*r I*r have*r gathered*r your*r children*r together*r as*r a*r hen*r gathers*r her*r brood*r under*r her*r wings,*r and*r you*r were*r not*r willing!*r
See,*r your*r house*r is*r left*r to*r you*r desolate.*r
For*r I*r tell*r you,*r you*r will*r not*r see*r me*r again,*r until*r you*r say,*r ‘Blessed*r is*r he*r who*r comes*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r Lord.’”*r
